charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. Since the beginning of the year I have been walking a lot more and really enjoying it; it has certainly improved both my physical and mental health. So when I saw Marie Curie’s Step into Spring Challenge, (walking 10,000 steps a day to raise money) I thought it the ideal fund raising challenge for me. Although I love walking I am a fair weather walker so this challenge will make me go out walking every day, regardless of the weather; and hopefully at the same time I will be raising much needed funds for a very worthy cause. Marie Curie is a charity close to my heart, not only because our daughter is a doctor at a Marie Curie Hospice, and we know from her all the good work that they do, but also because as a family we have needed their services. Some years ago my father-in-law was looked after at home by Marie Curie nurses and last year when my mother became very ill and required palliative end of life care, in particular pain control, she had to be admitted to the local hospital rather than being cared for at home which had been her wish, because the services weren’t available in her area of the country. Marie Curie Nurses and hospices have been working tirelessly throughout the pandemic, providing vital care and support, and a listening ear to people in need. They can’t keep doing this without support though and like all charities Marie Curie have found things really difficult during the past year. Just £20 would pay for one hour of Marie Curie nursing in a patient’s home, £300 would pay for one in-patient admission for acute symptom control in a Marie Curie Hospice. Please, please, please dig deep - every penny counts! Donating through this site is simple, fast and totally secure. It is also the most efficient way to sponsor me: Marie Curie UK will receive your money faster and, if you are a taxpayer, an extra 28% in tax will be added to your gift at no cost to you. Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story: I have witnessed first hand just what it means to patients and their families recieving care and support either in the Marie Curie Glasgow Hospice or from the Community Nursing Team at the end of life, when it is needed the most. This past year has been far from ordinary for any of us and the word has been turned upside down. Throughout it all Marie Curie have continued to provide vital end of life care and support to people in your local community. As COVID-19 has robbed us all of many things and Marie Curie the opportunity to raise vital funds during their annual March fundraising event, The Great Daffodil Appeal, I have decided to do what I can to help. Stepping into Spring, I pledge to take not 10 but 15,000 steps each day in March to raise as much money for this great cause as possible. All I ask is that you drop a small donation here to my page, no matter how small. Thank you- brighter days are coming 🌼 Holly 💛

charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
I'm doing at least 10k steps a day in March to raise much-needed funds for Marie Curie, in memory of my parents, Graham and Margaret Gault. And if it helps to burn off some of the lock-down pounds, that will be great too!

I have done some fundraising for Marie Curie every year since Mum died, to give something back for the amazing care they gave her, allowing Mum to spend her final months at home where she wanted to be.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
We are four Edinburgh College music students looking to put on a live stream concert for Marie Curie. For one of our modules in college we have opted to create a benefit concert which is being over-viewed by our lecturers. Our original plan was to put on a live gig within the college but due to the Covid-19 restrictions we have changed this to a live-streamed event. 

The event will be live streamed on our website on the 1st of May 2021. It will have a variety of performers of all ages and will showcase many different genres of music. These will all be pre-recorded videos edited together by us and streamed out live.

We promise you a night of fun-filled music to give us all a smile in these awful times. Our goal is to raise £500 for such a hard working and deserving charity and we would love if you could help make our dream a reality.
title: LCDC's Marie Curie Benefit Concert

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit Our JustGiving page.

Marie Curie nurses were amazing, kind hearted, , compassionate, understanding, patient, sensitive, all these words and more. Our families  had great comfort that Dad,/grandad - Mum/Nanny’s last few days/hours  with us, were peaceful and calm. 

For Anneli , Marie Curie came to my home for 10 nights. To me they were  angels, knowing that a Marie Curie nurse was sitting with my Dad each night was a blessing. I am part of a Marie Curie volunteer group to  help raise money so that other families are able to use the services provided by this wonderful charity..  I am truly grateful and by raising money for the Charity I can in some way give back . At the time  it was hard to come to terms with the news Dad was dying one thing I have not forgotten is how Marie Curie helped us at the time. Please  if you could sponsor and help me to give other families the comfort and peace that my family received from Marie Curie. 

For kim it gave her Dad, peace of mind.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Marie Curie Nurses work day and night looking after people with a terminal illness who want to be cared for at home in their final days – but they can only do so thanks to your generous support.

One hour of nursing care in someone’s home costs £20 – it costs £5,500 to keep our nursing service running across the UK for one hour.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Our mum sadly passed away on the 23rd February after her recent diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  During mums final days at home we were supported by Marie Curie  nurses (working in conjunction with St Luke's Hospice) four times a day and also overnight. 

The day care ensured that mum was tended to and any of her personal needs were met.  The night-time support was also invaluable at such a distressing time when mum needed 24 hour care as it  enabled Joanne and I to try and get some rest during the night when mum was often awake and in need of additional support.

The Marie Curie nurses were caring, compassionate, attentive, and respectful, and their time with mum was never rushed.  They also were there to offer words of comfort and support when tears flowed, or to offer advice when we had specific questions.

Mum's funeral will be held on Monday 29th March and we kindly request family flowers only but any donations that you would like to make in mum's memory, to support the amazing work of Marie Curie, will be gratefully received and much appreciated  


Juliet & Joanne x

Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story: 1 March is an important date for us; not just because it's the start of our 10 000 steps in March, raising funds for Marie Curry, but also because it's the first anniversary of our Mum's memorial. Mum died on holiday the day after Christmas in 2019. Her memorial was delayed as a result of waiting for her remains to be sent home. She loved yellow, she loved people, (she loved animals a bit more) she loved her husband, she loved her family, she loved her friends, she loved to laugh and she loved us! We undertake to walk 10 000 steps because we love our mum and she would be so chuffed to see us boosting our health and spreading laughter. We know the healing power of laughter and how it's helped us process our grief. We will laugh along the way and hopefully inspire others to laugh and walk too. Most of all, we want to share love and remind everyone how precious life is and how wonderful it can be when you have love and laughter. The Mom, here we go, we're off like  a herd of turtles...and we love you forever plus three xxx.
title: Tove and Lisa's 10 000 Laughter Steps into Spring ha ha

story: Marie Curie nurses are amazing. We all know someone whose final days have been made more bearable because of the care and compassion of these wonderful people. Many thanks in advance for your donations. xxx

charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
In Memory of Derek Rivitt who was taken from us too soon on 13th February 2021 after a short Illness.

In life we loved you dearly as a companion, Dad, Grandad

, Great Grandad and a true Friend. We will cherish your memory and feel sad at the years we will miss you. 


By donating to Marie Curie we will be helping and

supporting other people and families who find themselves in similar situations. They are such a  great charity to support. 


Many Thanks

Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

charity.name: Marie Curie
eventName: SPAR CO's Step into Spring Challenge
story:
This March we're asking all SPAR CO colleagues to challenge themselves and get sponsored to walk 10,000 steps every day in March for SPAR's charity partner, Marie Curie!


Marie Curie Nurses and hospices have been working tirelessly throughout the pandemic, providing vital care and support, and a listening ear to people in need. 

Marie Curie can’t care for families without our support. And that’s where you step in. Step into Spring is a fantastic way to support Marie Curie in a safe, distanced way.

You can Step into Spring wherever you choose. Step outside for a springtime stroll, leave the car at home for your daily shop, dance around the house, or even walk on the spot while you’re watching TV

Don't forget to record your activity on the SPAR CO Strava page, and send us pictures of what you get up to! 

How to take part...

1. Choose how you're going to count your steps - use your smartphone or a pedometer. 

2. Lace up your trainers or grab a pair of comfy slippers if you're stepping indoors

3. Share your challenge and this page with colleagues, friends and family, and ask for donations

4. Record your activity on the SPAR CO Strava page

How your support helps...

As little as £20 can fund an hour of nursing care for someone with a terminal illness in the comfort of their own home.

£32 can pay for a call to the Marie Curie Support line, meaning someone in need can pick up the phone and receive practical information and emotional support.

£180 will pay for a Marie Curie nurse to look after someone with a terminal illness for a full nine-hour shift

£400 will pay for someone to stay in a Marie Curie hospice for 24 hours, so they can receive the hands-on care they need in their final days,

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Our Solihull Hospice has been caring for local people since 1965.

Its a warm and welcoming place where we give expert care to people with a terminal illness, and their loved ones, every day of the year. 

Our hospice team includes doctors, nurses, physiotherapists, social workers and many more, and is supported by over 200 volunteers  who play a vital role in the running of the hospice.

We have a 24-bed in-patient unit, where relatives and friends can visit any time of the day or night, and stay with their loved ones if they wish.

Our out-patient unit offers clinics, therapies and group sessions  and freshly cooked lunches made by our chefs. We also support carers and families, including children, with practical advice, counselling and bereavement support groups.

We need to raise £9,600 per day to run the hospice, so every penny counts. Thank you for helping to make sure more people with a terminal illness in Solihull get the care and support they need.

Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story: In a short space of time, we lost two beautiful ladies who were very close to us. We know they both held a place in so many of your hearts! They both received incredible care from Marie Curie and although we don't believe we will ever be able to truly thank the Marie Curie enough we felt raising money on their behalf was the very least we could do. 10,000 steps a day in March, all donations will be sent to Marie Curie on behalf of Jemima Wallis & Fiona Smith. All family and friends welcome to join the challenge, please let Katie or Reece know you would like to take part and share this page. If you miss the 1st of march you could always double the steps another day!! All names of everyone who took part will be listed at the end. We appreciate it is a difficult time for everyone, all support is very greatly appreciated! Lots of love, Reece & Katie xx

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Some people may know that in April 2006, Gemma unfortunately died from cancer. In the couple months leading up to that, Gemma was given the best support available from Marie Curie. We were also offered some complementary therapies while she was there. We cannot begin to say how grateful we were for everything they done for us and for Gemma. 

Maisie never got to meet her Auntie Gemma, but knows all about her! And in some ways, Maisie is just like her (Gemma did threaten to haunt me at times, and no doubt this is her way!lol!) So Maisie has decided to make some crafts this month in the hope that she can raise some money for Marie Curie and help other people in need of help from Marie Curie! 

Times are hard at the minute for everyone! So please donate just what you can, Maisie says even a penny will help! 

Thank you very much in advance! 

Maisie and Gillian. xxx

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story: To try to put in to words how amazing the Marie Curie nurses are..it's close to impossible. When you know that you are losing one of the most loved of your family, the matriarch, the one who makes you laugh loudest, the heart of gold, the big Sis.. it's unbearable. But the Marie Curie nurses saw my family through the darkest hours with compassion, empathy and care. Without them, we would have found it much more difficult to bear. Please give what you can to raise money for the most giving and understanding of souls. My sister Marie was treated with such love and dignity and I will never forget that. Thanks so much. <U+0001F49B><U+0001F49B><U+0001F49B>
title: In memory of my big Sis Marie Gallagher

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. I'm dedicating this challenge to my lovely friend and neighbour Margaret (and Harry). 

Both past away last year, and all our family miss them very much. 

Margaret was a sensitive soul and always had time to listen or help if ever needed, especially sewing items for the whole street. 

Both Margaret and Harry spent almost 2 days helping me to make a huge Bradford city banner for my son Harrison to take to Wembley. 

My daughter Mollie-Mae still has Pinky the bear, which Margaret bought for her when she was born, and must have sewn it back together for her at least 10 times. 

To my amazement I actually can sew very well, I believe Margaret is my inspiration and obviously taught me very well. 

Thank you
title: Paula's Sew for Doh!!!
rememberedPersonSummary.name: Margaret  Metcalfe

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
As we enter March I will join many, many other people having a landmark birthday in Lockdown. Usually in March I would also be joining many people raising money for Marie Curie by standing in Tesco's entrance or in a town with a collection pot and a box of daffodils. But this year is different! So if you would normally pop a £1 in a pot at this time please take a moment to put a pound in my virtual bucket! The support of the Marie Curie nurses made all the difference to our family in the last few days before we lost our lovely Dad 15 years ago.

Thank you so much for choosing to support The Great Daffodil Appeal. Your help really does mean the world to thousands of people living with a terminal illness during these difficult times.

charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
story:
Too many people are still drowning. More than ever we need the RNLI’s help. As a charity, the RNLI depends on our donations so it can go on saving lives and keeping us and our loved ones safe. 

RNLI lifesavers are our lifeline. They’re the lifeboat crews who provide 24-hour search and rescue right around the UK and Ireland. The lifeguards keeping watch on 240 of the busiest beaches in the UK and Channel Islands. And the RNLI safety teams and educators working tirelessly to stop people getting into trouble in the first place.

Thank you.

eventName: Seamus Mc'Daid's 354 mile Walk for Lough Swilly RNLI
story:
RNLI Volunteer Seamus McDaid is walking the distance from Mizen to Malin Head in March to raise money for the  Lough Swilly RNLI. Seamus is following in the footsteps of his late uncle, Jamsie Quirke, who was the first person to complete the route in 1978. Back then, Jamsie walked the 354 miles from Ireland's most southerly tip to it's most northerly point at Malin Head to raise funds for Saint Vincent De Paul.

This year, due to lockdown restrictions, his nephew Seamus is restricted to the 5km exercise limit, so will be completing all 354 miles of his journey on the highways and byways of Buncrana.

Seamus will begin walking for the RNLI on March 1st and will complete his journey on Wednesday 31st March at Ned's Point. Seamus will be walking approximately 70 miles a day over the next 5 weeks, so expect to see a lot of him out and about next month!

Everyone at the Station would like to wish Seamus the best of luck on his Mizen to Malin challenge and hope he completes the walk before his 50th birthday in May never mind in 5 weeks!

RNLI lifeboats in Ireland protect hundreds of communities through our 24-hour search and rescue service. They rely on the safest, most reliable lifeboats and modern stations to launch from. Irelands unrivalled coasts and inland waters are valued by local communities and visitors alike, with millions travelling to enjoy them, and work on them each year. But the water remains an unpredictable environment that can catch people out. People will always need our help and we will always be there to answer that call.
title: Lough Swilly's Seamus Mc'Daid's 354 mile Walk for Lough Swilly RNLI

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
owner: Team MS - WWF 100 Miles in March
story:
WWF is at the heart of global efforts to address the world’s most important environmental challenges: safeguarding the natural world, tackling climate change and enabling people to use only their fair share of natural resources. Together we can build a future where people and nature thrive.

Your support is much appreciated.

Find out more by visiting wwf.org.uk

Your support is much appreciated.

charity.name: WWF-UK
story:
Today is my first today of committing to my 100 miles - For anyone that knows me you'll know how exciting it is for me to do my first ever fitness challenge after everything in these action packed 33 years.

 I wouldn't be here today without the incredible support of my amazing family and friends (along with a pretty amazing team of health professionals and some special new lungs from a beautiful soul) and if we aren't careful and without support from us we could lose some awe inspiring wildlife. So although I have already received so much from you and I feel like I shouldn't ask for more.... I am. Please will you add a few pounds to my funding page to help protect our wildlife and in turn our planet - we wont survive without our eco system -just as I wouldn't have survived without my much needed support system.

Dexter is very excited to be join me on this challenge and I have a few helpers ready to tag in if /when the health issues try to slow me down

 Thank you - sending love always x x

charity.name: Cool Earth
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m Mabel and my goal is to raise money and awareness of of our planet.

Our earth is slowly dying and so are we. We need to make a change soon or else out planet will die. There are so many ways you could help out, even the simplest things like picking up litter and putting it in the bin. All the money that I raise will be donated to charity to help the planet flourish.

I will be doing exercises, baking and other activities to set myself.

Thank you so much for reading this and hopefully donating, even just a little bit means the world to me. I can’t wait to help the environment flourish.

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
eventName: Alliance for Better Care supporting Unicef Covid Solidarity Fund
story:
Alliance for Better Care has now vaccinated over 100,000 patients across East Surrey and Mid-Sussex. As part of this milestone, we are calling on our team and patients to join us as we fundraise for the Unicef Childrens Covid Emergency Fund.

Unicef urgently need funds to expand the scale and scope of their work supporting children affected by coronavirus, especially in countries with weaker health systems.

£60 transports 4,205 doses of vaccines
£45 provides cold chain equipment to safely store 500 doses
of vaccine
£30 gives a full kit to protect a health worker, including
boots, gloves, masks and coveralls
£20 buys 781 pairs of gloves for health workers
£10 buys 56 bars of soap to help prevent the spread of the
disease
£5 provides 1,350 water purification tablets to purify water
in emergency situations

The impact of a large-scale outbreak of coronavirus on children, especially poor and vulnerable children, has been immense. Children are at risk from the disease, but also from the disruption to health and education services, impacts on caregivers, and separation from family members.

Unicef has been working closely with governments and the World Health Organization (WHO) since the start of the coronavirus outbreak. Donations made to our page will help to limit the spread of the virus and reduce the impact on children and families.

We want to ensure that we support people around the world
who don’t have sufficient funds to vaccinate their population or have the infrastructure to arrange a programme like we can in Surrey and Sussex.

We know that If we were to pay for the two doses of vaccine ourselves, it would cost between £5- £20 per person. If you would like to donate the equivalent of your vaccine, you can do that through us.
title: Unicef Childrens Covid Emergency Fund

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
eventName: A Mile a Day in March
story: During the month of March we will be running a mile a day (equivalent of 31miles) to raise funds for UNICEF. All money donated will go towards helping children in high-risk countries such as Yemen. Over 12 million children were already at risk in Yemen and now the COVID19 pandemic continues to put them in danger, with 80% of Yemen’s population in need of humanitarian aid and protection. More than five years of fighting has pushed Yemen and its health system to the brink of collapse. Millions of children lack access to clean water and sanitation facilities and are in desperate need of basic healthcare. Malnutrition is also at an all-time high, with 2 million children being malnourished. Just £11 could provide life-saving food for a child for a week. Thank you for taking the time to read and thanks for all your support.
title: Bethany’s page

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story: Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good.

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
eventName: Access agency's Manchester to Madagascar - 5,777 miles for WaterAid!
story:
From Manchester to Madagascar 

From 15th February, well be walking, running, cycling, rowing and swimming to travel the 5,777 miles between Manchester to Madagascar, all in aid of highlighting WaterAid's work in Antenanarivo, Madagascar.

5,777 miles might take us a while to complete, so we are going to compete in two teams and start at each end - one team in Manchester and one team in Madagascar - and the objective is to meet in the middle by Easter, and see who gets there first!

Well be walking, running, cycling, rowing or even swimming (when allowed!) to help contribute individually and virtually to the 5,777 miles we need to complete together. 

The objective is to improve all our wellbeing, get us all out more in the fresh air and away from our computers, and to raise £5,777 for a truly magnificent cause!
title: Access agency's Manchester to Madagascar - 5,777 miles for WaterAid!

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story: I'm walking for water so others don't have to. I'm walking for the millions of women and children who walk distances every day to get the water they need for themselves and their families to survive. I'm walking to raise funds so we can make clean water normal for everyone, everywhere. Clean water is a human right that everyone, everywhere should enjoy. But around the world 1 in 10 people have no choice but to drink dirty water, often from remote sources, risking their health, their safety and their chances in life. With clean water, people have an equal chance to be healthy, educated and financially secure. Communities can thrive.

But around the world 1 in 10 people have no choice but to drink dirty water, often from remote sources, risking their health, their safety and their chances in life. With clean water, people have an equal chance to be healthy, educated and financially secure. Communities can thrive.

charity.name: WaterAid
story: I'm walking for water so others don't have to. I will be walking 12km a day (16,000 steps) (372km in total) in the month of March. I'm walking for the millions of women and children who walk distances every day to get the water they need for themselves and their families to survive. I'm walking to raise funds so we can make clean water normal for everyone, everywhere. Clean water is a human right that everyone, everywhere should enjoy. But around the world 1 in 10 people have no choice but to drink dirty water, often from remote sources, risking their health, their safety and their chances in life. With clean water, people have an equal chance to be healthy, educated and financially secure. Communities can thrive.

charity.name: WaterAid
story: WaterAid is working to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. The international not-for-profit organisation works in 28 countries to change the lives of the poorest and most marginalised people. Since 1981, WaterAid has reached 26.4 million people with clean water and 26.3 million people with decent toilets.

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story: I'm walking for water so others don't have to. I'm walking for the millions of women and children who walk distances every day to get the water they need for themselves and their families to survive. I'm walking to raise funds so we can make clean water normal for everyone, everywhere. Clean water is a human right that everyone, everywhere should enjoy. But around the world 1 in 10 people have no choice but to drink dirty water, often from remote sources, risking their health, their safety and their chances in life. With clean water, people have an equal chance to be healthy, educated and financially secure. Communities can thrive.

charity.name: WaterAid
story: WaterAid is working to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. The international not-for-profit organisation works in 28 countries to change the lives of the poorest and most marginalised people. Since 1981, WaterAid has reached 26.4 million people with clean water and 26.3 million people with decent toilets.

charity.name: WaterAid
story: Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good.

charity.description: CARE International is one of the world’s leading aid agencies working in over 80 countries around the globe. We seek a world of hope, tolerance and social justice, with  women and girls at the centre, where poverty has been overcome, and people live with equal opportunities in security and dignity.
charity.name: CARE International UK
story:
This women's day Greenstone is raising donations for CARE International which is the leading NGO in women’s economic and social uplifting. 

Every £5 donation will also get you one ticket in our RAFFLE DRAW, the winner of which will receive a PRIZE! 

Greenstone will also match donations up to £50 per team member. 

Please make your donations through this page from Monday - Friday and the raffle winner will be announce at the Friday drinks. 

Thank you for your support! 

ABOUT CARE

CARE focuses on four interrelated pathways to women's economic empowerment and they contribute to the greatest impact: Dignified work, Financial inclusion, Women's entrepreneurship, Women in value chains. 

COVID has emphasized the need to make sure that women across the world are resilient in times of crisis and donations will go to supporting the most vulnerable. 

For more information see: https://www.careinternational.org.uk/

YOUR DONATION

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
